page.title: 16RECREATION IN APPLETON WISKE
page.content: Several different venues are used for recreational activities . The Village Hall is the most used,see page 14.The school is used for meetings of the Parish Council,WEA meetings most PTA events and the village Choir run by Mr Sleigtholme .The young Adventurers meet in St.Marys church and the village band conducted by Mr Sleightholme practices in the Wesleyan Chapel.Amongst locals the Lord Nelson is the most used public house,Friday night being the busiest.the recreation field bought earlier this year is well used by the children .The most popular hobbies are gardening,swimming ,handicrafts and badminton.Appleton is within easy reach of swimming baths in nearby towns.Most people are satisfied with the wide range of recreational opportunities provided in the village .by R.Sunderland & S.Gardiner
